poem:
Title: "To Sir Tony, In Memoriam"

Through the drizzle of Lancashire rain,
a wry smile danced on Sir Tony's brave face,
His laughter unyielding to any political mace.

In East Timor, under the UN's peaceful guise,
He bore the weight of people's cries.
A Latin lover, yet Asian in spirit,
Order and duty met his wit.

Now, from the quiet heavens above,
He laughs still, his heart full of love.
